ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Bilateral Profound Sensorineural Hearing Loss
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Progressive hearing loss over 25 years with loss of residual low-frequency hearing in the right ear.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Right Cochlear Implant Failure (Hybrid)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Loss of residual acoustic hearing rendered the hybrid acoustic component ineffective, resulting in poor speech recognition (10%).

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Left Cochlear Implant Electrode Fold-over
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: CT scan revealed the electrode array folded back on itself in the basal turn, though performance remained satisfactory.

ordered_list.rationale_short: Assess current residual hearing levels, particularly in the right ear.
Evaluate aided detection thresholds with current devices.
Assess functional speech recognition in quiet to determine benefit from each device.
Visualize electrode placement and cochlear anatomy prior to potential revision surgery.
Evaluate vestibular function (VNG, CDP) given patient history of dizziness to assess surgical risk.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Initial evaluation for reprogramming revealed profound SNHL. The right Hybrid CI provided minimal benefit (10% speech recognition) due to loss of residual hearing. The left Standard CI provided good benefit (76%).

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Profound SNHL bilaterally. Right ear measurable at 500-750 Hz (105-110 dB HL); no measurable hearing in left ear.

tests.name: Sound-field Thresholds
tests.result_summary: Right Hybrid CI thresholds 40-95 dB HL; Left Standard CI thresholds 15-30 dB HL.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: AzBio in quiet (60 dB SPL): Right CI 10%, Left CI 76%, Bilateral 76%.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Follow-up 1 month after reprogramming adjustments. Aided thresholds improved, but speech recognition showed no significant change.

tests.name: Sound-field Thresholds
tests.result_summary: Improved to expected levels at 250-3000 Hz. Thresholds at 4000-6000 Hz remained 45 dB HL and 'no response'.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: No significant change from initial evaluation.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Pre-operative workup for reimplantation. CT imaging confirmed good position of right Hybrid leads but revealed an electrode fold-over in the left ear. Vestibular function was normal.

tests.name: CT Scan
tests.result_summary: Right Hybrid leads in good position. Left CI showed electrode fold-over in the ascending limb of the basal turn.

tests.name: Vestibular Assessment
tests.result_summary: Normal vestibular function bilaterally (VNG and CDP).

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Intraoperative and postoperative confirmation of right ear reimplantation.

tests.name: Plain film X-ray
tests.result_summary: Confirmed placement of the full electrode insertion in the right ear.

tests.name: Neural Response Telemetry (NRT)
tests.result_summary: Revealed responses across several electrodes with good morphology.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Activation of new processor 1 month postsurgery. Patient reported immediate improvement in speech recognition and 'fuller' sound quality.
Follow-up 6 months post-reactivation. The patient demonstrated significant improvement, with right ear performance (92%) surpassing the left ear.

tests.name: Sound-field Thresholds
tests.result_summary: Right CI thresholds improved to 20-25 dB HL.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: AzBio in quiet: Right CI 92%, Left CI 68%, Bilateral 96%.

proposed_items: Reprogramming of right CI (FAT adjustment, frequency cutoffs) attempted initially.
Reimplantation of right ear with standard electrode array (Cochlear Corporation Freedom Contour).
Plain film X-ray to confirm electrode placement.
Activation of new processor 1 month postsurgery.
counseling_actions: Explained that the Hybrid device was no longer beneficial due to loss of residual low-frequency hearing.
Advised that reimplantation with a standard array would likely improve speech recognition.
Discussed the electrode fold-over in the left ear but recommended against revision as performance was good.
Reassured the patient regarding dizziness risks for surgery based on normal vestibular assessment.

escalation.rationale_short: Referral for reimplantation of the right ear due to loss of benefit from the Hybrid device.

follow_up_plan.timeline: 1 month postsurgery for activation, then 6 months post-reactivation
follow_up_plan.objective: Activate the new device and assess speech recognition outcomes.

expected_outcome: Aided sound-field thresholds (Right CI) improved to 20-25 dB HL.
AzBio sentences in quiet (Right CI) improved from 10% to 92%.
AzBio sentences in quiet (Left CI) scored 68%.
Patient reported immediate improvement in speech recognition and 'fuller' sound quality.
